div.head: Introduction
div.p: Proyecto Humboldt Digital (ProHD) is an international initiative for advanced training in the Digital Humanities at two locations: Havana (Oficina del Historiador de la Ciudad de La Habana) and Berlin (Berlin-Brandenburg Academy of Sciences and Humanities).

The project focuses on the study of Cuban scientific and literary culture of the 18th and 19th centuries, especially on the exploration of sources relevant to Alexander von Humboldt's research on Cuba during the period of 1800–1830.

ProHD started in 2019 and is scheduled for completion in 2023. It has been funded thanks to generous support by the Federal Foreign Office of Germany, the Fritz Thyssen Foundation, and the Gerda Henkel Foundation.

div.head: Content
div.p: The "Digital Dossier: Alexander von Humboldt and Cuba (1800–1830)" contains transcriptions of textual documents in manuscript format, in three languages (English, French, and Spanish). They all relate to Humboldt's trip to Cuba and the questions the Prussian scientist studied in the Essai politique sur l'île de Cuba (2 vols., Paris 1826). The textual sources of the edited documents published in the "Digital Dossier" stem from libraries and archives in Germany, Cuba and Poland. For more information on the documents' provenance, please consult the metadata section of each text.
To learn more about text setting and coding in TEI format, please refer to the Editorial principles section.

div.head: Technical Aspects
div.p: All the texts and the corresponding metadata published in the "Digital Dossier" have been encoded in XML format following the Text Encoding Initiative (P5) Guidelines. To facilitate the encoding task, the framework ediarum developed by TELOTA has been adapted resulting in ediarum.PROHD.edit.

The TEI markup captures metadata about the documents, such as the source, those responsible for the edition and, whenever possible, the authorship and other data related to the creation of the texts. Regarding the texts themselves, the following information is encoded:
Pagination of the original source,
headings and paragraphs,
logical divisions of letters,
changes in typography, as well as
authorial interventions such as strikethroughs or additions, uncertain readings, gaps, supplied words, etc. For more details on our TEI markup, please visit Editorial principles.

This web application has been built with TEI Publisher (v. 8.0.0.), eXistDB (v. 5.2.0.) and Cantaloupe Image Server (v. 5.3.1). An ODD (prohd.xml) is used to style the editions and static pages and two templates (prohd.html, view-grid-prohd.html) are used to build the graphical user interface with web components. A copy of the files that make up the web application is available at the project's Github repository and also available at Zenodo. Both the web application and the facsimiles are hosted on servers of the Oficina del Historiador de la Ciudad de La Habana; the facsimiles use IIIF's API.
The development of the framework ediarum.PROHD.edit and of this web application has been carried out by Antonio Rojas Castro with the collaboration of Violeta López.
Regarding the accessibility of this website, the WCAG 2.1 standard has been taken into account. If you encounter accessibility problems or have suggestions for improvement, please contact us.

div.head: Recommended citation
div.p: You may cite the "Digital Dossier" in its entirety as follows:

Kraft, Tobias (dir.). Digital Dossier: Alexander von Humboldt and Cuba (1800-1830), Berlin-Brandenburgische Akademie der Wissenschaften and Oficina del Historiador de la Ciudad de la Habana, 2021-2023.
Or a specific individual edition:

Arango y Parreño, Francisco de. "Observaciones sobre el Ensayo politico con relacion a la Isla de Cuba que ha escrito el Señor Baron de Humboldt". Digital Dossier: Alexander von Humboldt and Cuba (1800-1830), Kathrin Kraller (ed.), Berlin-Brandenburgische Akademie der Wissenschaften and Oficina del Historiador de la Ciudad de la Habana, 2021.
